#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Know Yourself when You Do n't Have a Mother
#Text=Understanding yourself is often a little easier if you know where you came from .
#Text=But if you do not have a mother in your life , this can be a part of your life story that you will never know quite the same way as other people .
#Text=And that can leave an emptiness in a person 's heart .
#Text=It can make simple questions of connection a mystery .

#Text=But whether your mother is dead , or you were adopted by another family as a child , or for some other reason your mother is not present in your life -- it helps to know that there are ways to make connections that can help you understand yourself .
#Text=This article will teach you how to know yourself , despite losing your mother or never knowing her .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Remember your childhood memories of your mother , if you have any .
#Text=Recall what you can about the time you spent with your mother .
#Text=All memories are precious , even those that make us sad or angry , even those that seem pointless .
#Text=You may only recall vague details about your mother , her smell , the way she sang to you , the books she read to you , the things she told you off for even .

#Text=All of these have influenced you , and , they are still in your head , so something in your brain hung onto those memories , what you remember is part of what makes you unique , part of what makes you you , a way for you to know yourself .
#Text=Ask others to tell you their memories of your mother , whether you have any memories of your own or not , you can ask others what they know of her .
#Text=If you lost your mother when you were older , you might like to find out about what your mother was like at your age , be that twelve , twenty , thirty-six , forty or any other age .
#Text=You may be told you are like your mother was .
#Text=You might hear stories that you identify with or a tale that makes you think , " that 's just what I would of done in that situation " .
#Text=You can know yourself by identifying with others in this way , and if you identify with your mother , you can feel a connection with her even though she is no longer around .
#Text=You may be nothing like your mother , that 's okay , you are yourself , not your mother .
#Text=Knowing if you are not like her or if you are just like her , or even a bit like her , all help you to know yourself and how alike or not you are to your mother .
#Text=Recognize that what you experience and how you get through things , good and bad , are what make you " you " .
#Text=You may have turned out a completely different person if your mother had been around for your whole life .

#Text=Her passing has had a huge influence on your life , however old or young you were when you lost her , whether you feel it or not , even if you had another supportive care giver who took great care of you , your mother may have done things differently and raised a different you , only different of course , not a better you , and not a worse one either .
#Text=You are the person you are because of your mother 's passing , and that in and of itself is a piece of yourself .
#Text=In some case some your mother 's information will be available when you reach adulthood .
#Text=For instance , if you were adopted , you may be able to find out your birth information if your family chooses to withhold that information .
#Text=If there was a family tragedy such as a death , you may be able to gain information such as court records if you choose to research it .
#Text=You may not be able to find out anything .
#Text=In some circumstances , you may not be able to find out anything about your mother .
#Text=For instance , if you were abandoned as an infant , and no one knows your birth mother .
#Text=Or you were part of a closed adoption .
#Text=You are you , whoever your mother is or was .
#Text=Whatever you remember , find out , or otherwise know about your mother , remember that you are a unique , separate individual -- just like everyone else gets to discover .
#Text=While it often helps to know your biological or family history , in the end , your story is your own .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Other people who were close to your mother may get upset remembering things about her .
#Text=It could be because of the pain of missing her , anger about hurtful things she did , or confusion about choices she made -- and perhaps all of these at the same time .
#Text=Remember that this has no reflection on you , that it may be hard for others to talk about these things , and you likely had no responsibility for your mother .
#Text=Be careful in dealing with mothers that have had issues of responsibility , criminal activity , abuse towards others and so on .
#Text=Sometimes children are so eager to establish a relationship they become blind to the fact that such a relationship may have been broken for a reason .
#Text=Be careful .
#Text=If family members are reluctant to give out sensitive information about your mother , be respectful of their judgement .
#Text=Some information may not really be useful to you and cause you or others unnecessary hurt .
#Text=Often information may be revealed to you when you are judged mature enough to process the facts .
#Text=You may get hurt depending on how it turns out .
